messages.content: What is the purpose of the color2rgb plugin?

The color2rgb plugin is designed to complement the [comfyui layer style](https://github.com/chflame163/ComfyUI_LayerStyle) color picker node. It outputs the R, G, B values separately, which is more convenient for use with the imagetextoutlined node. The use case of this plugin may not be very widespread, but it is quite bothersome without it, as remembering RGB values can be cumbersome.
How does the color2rgb plugin generate color values?

Specific implementation details of how color2rgb generates color values are not provided in the text. Generally, such a plugin would likely use a combination of color theory and potentially custom algorithms or functions to map color styles or input values to RGB values.
How is the color2rgb plugin applied in ComfyUI?

After copying the color2rgb plugin file to the custom_nodes folder and restarting ComfyUI, the color2rgb node becomes available in the utils section. The application of the plugin is showcased in the provided images, which demonstrate its placement and integration within the ComfyUI interface.
What kind of benefits does the color2rgb plugin offer?
The color2rgb plugin offers convenience by providing separate RGB values for color selection, which can be more intuitive and user-friendly compared to manually memorizing or looking up RGB values.
How does the color2rgb plugin integrate with the imagetextoutlined node?

While the specific implementation details of how color2rgb integrates with the imagetextoutlined node are not provided, it can be inferred that the output RGB values from color2rgb are used by imagetextoutlined to generate or modify text outlines in images with specific colors.
What issues does the use of color2rgb mitigate?
The use of color2rgb mitigates the issue of manually remembering RGB values, which can be a tedious and error-prone task, particularly for color selection in design and editing tools.
